publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3936 Mr John Swinney: Temporary Relocation of the Stone of Destiny to Scone Palace in May 2006—That the Parliament expresses its regret at the decision of the First Minister not to permit the relocation of the Stone of Destiny to Scone Palace for a temporary period in May 2006 in connection with the 700th anniversary of the coronation of Robert the Bruce at Scone Palace; applauds Scone Palace on the series of events which it has planned in relation to this event in May to boost the local economy; believes that this is an important opportunity to increase awareness of Scottish history that would have been enhanced by the presence of the Stone of Destiny, and appeals to the First Minister to reconsider his decision.
S2M-3936 Temporary Relocation of the Stone of Destiny to Scone Palace in May 2006 (lodged on 8 February 2006) Donald Gorrie*

S2M-3936 Mr John Swinney: Temporary Relocation of the Stone of Destiny to Scone Palace in May 2006—That the Parliament expresses its regret at the decision of the First Minister not to permit the relocation of the Stone of Destiny to Scone Palace for a temporary period in May 2006 in connection with the 700th anniversary of the coronation of Robert the Bruce at Scone Palace; applauds Scone Palace on the series of events which it has planned in relation to this event in May to boost the local economy; believes that this is an important opportunity to increase awareness of Scottish history that would have been enhanced by the presence of the Stone of Destiny, and appeals to the First Minister to reconsider his decision. Supported by: Donald Gorrie
S2M-3936 Temporary Relocation of the Stone of Destiny to Scone Palace in May 2006 (lodged on 8 February 2006) Brian Adam*, Christine Grahame*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-3936 Temporary Relocation of the Stone of Destiny to Scone Palace in May 2006 (lodged on 8 February 2006) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Michael Matheson*
